title.native: あまんちゅ！～あどばんす～

description:
The second season of Amanchu!

Hikari Kohinata and Futaba Ooki have together found joy in many things through scuba diving and the most everyday of events. Hikari was born and brought up in a small oceanside town on Izu, and Futaba moved there from Tokyo, but the two polar opposites met at Yumegaoka High and instantly hit it off. The always-reserved Futaba found her perfect foil in the cheery and optimistic Hikari, and their friendship gave her the courage to take the first step and experience many of the smaller joys in life. She also took the Open Water Diver exam and passed, and now she has her sights set on the Advanced Open Water Diver certification.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

node.description:
Kozue Amano is a female Japanese manga artist. She is widely known as the creator of Aria, which proved to be a best-selling hit, and was adapted into an anime television series consisting of three seasons, two OVAs, and two movies.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aquaria2go)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/satojumichi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐藤順一)

Junichi Satou is a Japanese anime director, best known for working on shoujo-based anime and in the magical girl genre. He was formerly associated with [TYO Animations](https://anilist.co/studio/333/), formerly known as [Hal Film Maker](https://anilist.co/studio/34/).

Satou’s first major work was directing the first, and a portion of the second season of [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/530/) for [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/), after which he handed the position over to [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/), although he continued to storyboard and direct episodes for the later seasons. Satou later went on to co-direct [Ojamajo Doremi](https://anilist.co/anime/350/) alongside [Takuya Igarashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105087/), as well as the critically acclaimed [Princess Tutu](https://anilist.co/anime/721/). Satou served as chief director for long-runner [Sgt. Frog](https://anilist.co/anime/516/), and in recent years has become more known for his iyashikei works such as [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477/) and [Tamayura](https://anilist.co/anime/9055/).

He's married to [Yasuno Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/144094/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mill_sister)** | **[Website (blog)](https://blog.goo.ne.jp/gooussy)**

Kiyoko Sayama is a Japanese director, episode director, animation director and storyboard artist.

Married to [Tetsuya Kumagai](https://anilist.co/staff/101548/Tetsuya-Kumagai).

GONTITI is a Japanese world music guitar duo formed by Masahiko "Gonzalez" Mikami and Masahide "Titi" Matsumura.  Acoustic guitarists "GONZALEZ" Mikami and "TiTi" (pronounced Chi-Chi, as in the Charlie Parker masterpiece) Matsumura teamed up in Osaka in1978 to form "GONTITI".  Gonzalez Mikami was born December 30, 1953, in Osaka, Japan.   Titi Matsumura was born September 6, 1954, in Osaka, Japan.  (Source: homepage2.nifty.com, gontiti.jp)

[Website](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/suzuki-minori.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minoringo_staff) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7f1T-CF50uNMmGK_I9cILQ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/3Ath9xfI4WBdrZPFQ4VX9A?si=RqHEeCs9Sci2RtrWnmqvfQ) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/minoringo_official/)

She got picked out of 8000 people for the role of [Freyja Wion](https://anilist.co/character/90101/Freyja-Wion). She had no prior voice acting work.

Minori Suzuki is a member of the real-life idol group, [Walküre](https://anilist.co/staff/226500/Walkre)

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.

__Favorite Colors:__ Pink, brown
__Hobbies:__ Performing, reading, singing

[Official Website](http://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/maaya/) | [LINE Blog](https://lineblog.me/sakamotomaaya/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/maayasakamotoCh) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maaya_Sakamoto) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%9D%82%E6%9C%AC%E7%9C%9F%E7%B6%BE)

Married frequent costar [Kenichi Suzumura](https://anilist.co/staff/95005) on August 8, 2011.

Kanno's earliest experiences with music came from attending church with her parents. She studied keyboard from a young age on both the piano in her home and the organ at her kindergarten. In elementary school, she began participating in composition contests, but in high school, Kanno began to take more of an interest in literature than in music.

She attended Waseda University, where she majored in literature, but she transcribed music for various student groups at Waseda in her free time. While in university, Koei, a Japanese video game company, asked her to compose the soundtrack to Nobunaga's Ambition. The game turned out to be a hit, and Kanno's music career was launched.

Kanno has also composed music for artists such as [Maaya Sakamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95090/), [Megumi Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/96105/) and [Kyouko Koizumi](https://anilist.co/staff/164646/). She is also a keyboardist, as well as the frontwoman for [Seatbelts](https://anilist.co/staff/193673/), who perform many of Kanno's compositions and soundtracks.

She has collaborated with directors [Shinichirou Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/97009/) and [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/) multiple times.

In addition to Japanese, she speaks a little English and some French.

**Birthplace:** Niigata City, Niigata Prefecture, Japan
**Major:** National History

**[Website](http://www.yuhoiwasato.com/)**

**Iwasato Yuuho** is a Japanese lyricist and essayist (and former singer-songwriter), who is well-known for writing the lyrics to many anime theme songs. She graduated from Chuo University Faculty of Letters, Department of History, majoring in national history.

GONTITI is a Japanese world music guitar duo formed by Masahiko "Gonzalez" Mikami and Masahide "Titi" Matsumura.  Acoustic guitarists "GONZALEZ" Mikami and "TiTi" (pronounced Chi-Chi, as in the Charlie Parker masterpiece) Matsumura teamed up in Osaka in1978 to form "GONTITI".  Gonzalez Mikami was born December 30, 1953, in Osaka, Japan.   Titi Matsumura was born September 6, 1954, in Osaka, Japan.  (Source: homepage2.nifty.com, gontiti.jp)
